title: WTT: MY 1988 Topps for Your Tobacco Cards
author: mintacular

posts.post_title: WTT: MY 1988 Topps for Your Tobacco Cards
posts.post_content: Prefer T206 with rarer backs (Hindu, BL, etc.) in VGEX or better with great eye appeal. I have plenty of 1988 Topps BB loaded with rookies and future stars for trade. PM me your offers.

[quote name="mintacular" post=1105578]Prefer T206 with rarer backs (Hindu, BL, etc.) in VGEX or better with great eye appeal. I have plenty of 1988 Topps BB loaded with rookies and future stars for trade. PM me your offers.[/QUOTE]

You may be fishing with the wrong bait in this pond. Good luck.

If it only had been 1989 Fleer maybe we coulda had something going.  Maybe next time.

Brian
PM sent, but not interested in 1988 topps . . .
Early April Fools Day joke obviously....
Sorry, i thought this would provide some humor at the beginning of the day

[quote name="mintacular" post=1105634]Sorry, i thought this would provide some humor at the beginning of the day[/QUOTE]

It did.  I had to fight to keep the coffee from spraying out of my mouth!
Genius!  Why didn't I think of this?
I have a t206 that I will trade for 2,000,000 1988 Topps.  You pay the shipping. Let me know.

[quote name="buymycards" post=1106419]I have a t206 that I will trade for 2,000,000 1988 Topps.  You pay the shipping. Let me know.[/QUOTE]

Rick, I have a friend in your area who will take your T206 in trade but you would have to agree to take 3,000,000 1988 Topps off his hands.

How about this 1988 Donruss Mike LaValliere?  It looks undergraded to me.

[IMG]http://monozygotic.files.wordpress.com/2009/12/psa1.jpg[/IMG]
hows it working do you have any yet?
Have any Ken Caminiti rookie cards?  I have lots of T205's and T206's but not a single Caminiti rookie in my collection.
My '88 Topps are pretty sacred to me but I do have the ULTRA RARE '88 Donruss Pagnozzi Die-Cut I'd be willing to part with---Looking for possible "Jumbo" Wagner in return.
